content: You are a helpful assistant that can help users plan their trips.
Hi! What can I help you with? For example: itinerary planning, information lookup, or organizing things into a table.
I'd like to do a one-day trip to Hangzhou this weekend. I prefer a relaxed route. Can you plan it for me?
Sure. I'll first check the weather in Hangzhou this weekend so we can balance outdoor vs. indoor activities.

{"city":"Hangzhou","date":"2026-02-07","forecast":"Cloudy turning to light rain","temp_c":"6~12","wind":"Northeast wind, level 3","advice":["Bring an umbrella","Wear a waterproof jacket","Schedule outdoor activities earlier"]}

The forecast is cloudy turning to light rain. I'd recommend doing the main outdoor part in the morning, and leaving more indoor / easily-switchable activities for the afternoon.

Here's a relaxed one-day route (default starting from Hangzhou East Railway Station (Hangzhou Dongzhan) / downtown):
1) 09:00-11:30 West Lake (Xihu): Broken Bridge (Duanqiao) - Bai Causeway (Bai Di) - Su Causeway (Su Di), slow-paced walk
2) 11:30-12:30 Lunch (choose around West Lake to avoid backtracking)
3) 13:00-14:30 China National Silk Museum / Zhejiang Provincial Museum (prefer indoor if it rains)
4) 15:00-16:30 Hefang Street (Hefang Jie) / Southern Song Imperial Street (Nansong Yujie) (walkable in light rain; watch for slippery ground)
5) 17:00-18:30 Dinner and return

Do you prefer nature scenery (West Lake / Jiuxi (Jiuxi Shibajian)) or museums (Zhejiang Provincial Museum / Silk Museum)? I can fine-tune the plan based on your preference.
I prefer staying around West Lake. Budget is within 150 CNY per person. I'd like Hangzhou cuisine for lunch, ideally with shorter queues.
Got it. I'll look up lunch options around West Lake with per-person budget <= 150 CNY, Hangzhou cuisine, and usually manageable queue times.

Based on your budget (<= 150 CNY), Hangzhou cuisine, and trying to minimize waiting, here are 3 lunch options (from "most convenient" to "quietest"): 

A) Hangwei Xiaoguan (West Lake Branch) (best fit with the West Lake walking route)
- Suggested arrival: around 11:10
- Recommended: Longjing Shrimp + Pian'erchuan noodles + seasonal greens

B) Home-Style Hangzhou Cuisine (Hubin Branch) (close to the pedestrian street; easy to continue after lunch)
- Suggested arrival: 11:00-11:15
- Recommended: Dongpo Pork + Sister Song Fish Soup + seasonal greens

C) Xiaohe Straight Street area (quieter and usually shorter queues, but breaks the West Lake walking flow)
- Best if: you want a more comfortable dining pace

Where are you starting from (Hangzhou East Railway Station / Wulin Square / Hubin area)? I can insert the lunch spot into your West Lake route precisely to avoid backtracking.
Starting from Hangzhou East Railway Station. Please organize your one-day itinerary into a table including time / place / transportation / notes.

| Time | Place | Transportation | Notes |
|---|---|---|---|
| 09:00 | Hangzhou East Railway Station (Hangzhou Dongzhan) â†’ Broken Bridge (Duanqiao), West Lake (Xihu) | Metro / taxi (either) | Leave early to avoid crowds and finish outdoor parts first |
| 09:30-11:30 | West Lake (Xihu): Broken Bridge - Bai Causeway - Su Causeway (relaxed walk) | Walk | Cloudy turning to light rain; bring an umbrella and wear non-slip shoes |
| 11:30-12:30 | Lunch (Hangzhou cuisine) | Walk / short taxi ride | Arrive before ~11:10 to reduce waiting |
| 13:00-14:30 | Indoor backup: China National Silk Museum / Zhejiang Provincial Museum | Taxi / bus | If it rains, prioritize indoor; keep the pace relaxed |
| 15:00-16:30 | Hefang Street (Hefang Jie) / Southern Song Imperial Street (Nansong Yujie) | Taxi / metro + walk | Walkable in light rain; watch for slippery ground |
| 17:00-18:30 | Dinner & return | Taxi / metro depending on location | If you're not energetic, pick a dinner spot near a metro station |
Finally, give me a summary within 50 words, and list 3 things to note.
